content: tree planter toque by erin trolley a ribbed beanie that is warm enough to be worn on the coldest wettest spring morning while out on the block putting your first box in the ground and stylish enough to be worn in town on day off without locals knowing that you re a planter maybe skills knit purl circular knitting decreasing stitches abbreviations sts = stitches p = purl k = knit sm = slip marker pm = place marker ssk = slip slip knit k2tog = knit two adjacent stitches together * = repeat what you need 4 mm us 6 16 40 cm circular needle or size needed for gauge 4 mm us 6 double pointed needles for crown if not using magic loop approximately 100 grams of any worsted weight wool 1 you require approximately 150 m of worsted weight wool using a 100 g ball you will have some left over 4 stitch markers darning needle measuring tape gauge approximately 20 sts over 10 cm 4 in 1x1 ribbing since the ribbing will stretch to fit exact gauge is not crucial sizing due to the ribbed construction this hat should fit any teen to adult sized head 21-22 but will stretch to 23-24 53-56 cm but will stretch to 58-61 cm directions 1 cast on 96 sts using german twisted cast on or your preferred method of stretchy cast on 2 place marker and join to knit in the round being careful not to twist any stitches 3 work sts as k1 p1 until hat measures 23 cm 9 from cast on edge 4 *work 24 sts pm* until you have a marker every 24 sts for a total of four sections crown decreases round 1 *ssk k the knits and p the purls to 2 sts before the next marker k2tog sm* repeat 4 times 8 sts decreased round 2 k all knits p all purls 5 repeat round 1 and 2 until 12 sts remain between each marker 48 sts total 6 work round 1 only every row until 4 sts remain between each marker 16 sts total finishing 7 thread yarn through the remaining 16 sts pull tightly and secure on the inside of the toque 8 weave in ends crown and brim for pattern support email woolendreaming@gmail com share your finished project on instagram using the hashtag #treeplantertoque and tagging @woolen_dreaming 2 disclaimer i am happy to allow small scale commission hand knitting of my designs but you may not sell or reproduce this pattern or commercially manufacture any garment made from it thank you in advance for respecting my labour and intellectual property © erin trolley 2020 3
